weatherForecast.comment:
The light precipitation will subside in the evening. The night will bring precipitation-free weather, with some soft spells. On Sunday, the mountain peaks will become increasingly foggy from early in the morning and rain and snow will occur frequently in the morning. The snowfall level will fluctuate between the valleys and 1000 metres above sea level. The wind will blow moderately to briskly from the south, at an altitude of 2000 metres it will be -3 to -1 degrees.
The temperature at an altitude of 2000 metres is around -2 degrees. The temperature at an altitude of 1500 metres is around -1 degrees. Strong winds with gusts around 70 km/h from the south. Amounts of new snow between 10 and 25 cm are expected.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Fresh wind slab in the northern sector!
avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is rated as moderate above the tree line and low below. The main problem is wind slab. The avalanche prone locations are in the terrain adjacent to ridgelines and in the entrance areas of gullies and bowls. The northern sector is particularly affected. Triggering of a snow slab is possible with a small additional load. The slab can slide to the bottom, so medium avalanches cannot be ruled out.

snowpackStructure.comment: On Sunday, 10 to 25 cm of new snow will fall with wind on a crust can form and hardness with partial surface hoar. The connection between the fresh wind slab and the old snowpack will not be sufficient.  The snow base, fundamentally set and compact. In extremely steep gullies on shady slopes, the snow base, fundament is partly weakened by angular shapes.

tendency.highlights: On Monday morning, residual clouds and the last showers, increasingly sunny during the day. Sunny weather on Tuesday under the influence of intermediate highs. No significant change in the avalanche danger is expected.

weatherForecast.comment: The light precipitation will subside in the evening. The night will bring precipitation-free weather, with some soft spells. On Sunday, the mountain peaks will become increasingly foggy from early in the morning and rain and snow will occur frequently in the morning. A few centimetres of new fallen snow will accumulate, especially from the main Alpine ridge southwards, but there will be hardly any snow in the Totes Gebirge or on the Dachstein. At an altitude of 2000 metres it will be -3 to -1 degrees. The temperature at an altitude of 2000 metres is around -1 degrees. The temperature at an altitude of 1500 metres is between -1 and 3 degrees. Brisk to strong winds with gusts of 60 to 80 km/h from the south. The snowfall level will be between the valleys and around 1400 metres above sea level. Amounts of new snow of up to 10 cm are expected.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Persistent weak layer problem in northern and eastern aspects!
avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche risk is assessed as moderate above 1,800 metres and low below that. Slab avalanches can be triggered in some places even with little additional load and can reach medium size when breaking through the persistent weak layer. The danger areas are still located in the north to east aspects behind ridgelines and terrain edges as well as in the entrance areas to steep gullies and bowls.

snowpackStructure.comment: Some new or drift snow covers surface hoar and, at higher altitudes, older drift snow in the northern and eastern exposures on an unstable snowpack with weak layers of faceted crystals and floating snow. The connection between the wind slab and the old snowpack will not be sufficient. On the sunny slopes, the old snowpack is mostly settled and quite compact.

tendency.highlights: On Monday morning, residual clouds and the last showers, increasingly sunny during the day. Sunny weather on Tuesday under the influence of intermediate highs. No significant change in the avalanche danger is expected.

weatherForecast.comment: The light precipitation will subside in the evening. The night will bring precipitation-free weather, with some soft spells. On Sunday, the mountain peaks will become increasingly foggy from early in the morning and rain and snow will occur frequently in the morning. A few centimetres of new fallen snow will accumulate, especially from the main Alpine ridge southwards, but it will hardly snow at all in the Totes Gebirge or on the Dachstein. The snowfall level will fluctuate between valley locations and 1000 metres above sea level. The wind will blow moderately to briskly from the south.  The temperature at an altitude of 1500 metres is around -2 degrees. The temperature at an altitude of 1000 metres will be around 1 degree. Moderate winds with gusts around 40 km/h from the south. Amounts of new snow between 10 and 15 cm are expected.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Low avalanche danger, isolated avalanche prone locations on shady slopes!
avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche risk is low. In extremely steep gullies and on shady slopes above the tree line, the triggering of small slab avalanches cannot be completely ruled out. Avalanche prone locations may be difficult to recognise due to poor visibility and a thin covering of soft new fallen snow.

snowpackStructure.comment: Some new fallen snow is deposited on a crusted can form. Angular shapes weaken the snow layering. Some grassy slopes are snowed in again.

tendency.highlights: On Monday morning, residual clouds and the last showers, increasingly sunny during the day. Sunny weather on Tuesday under the influence of intermediate highs. No significant change in the avalanche danger is expected.

ALBINA.generalHeadline: New fallen snow - focus on the Gurk and Seetal Alps!
